content: Over 25 years ago, I played both "The 7th Guest" and "The 11th Hour" and thought they were brilliant. But games and technology have evolved quite a bit since then. The mere fact that you can now play a game like this one on a tablet attests to that. Today, I find that while it was fun revisiting this old game I had loved so much, it just cannot compare to more recent games such as "The Room" and "The Da Vinci House" series.

I used to have this on PC CDROM, I'm pretty sure I still have it somewhere, but a classic, I used to be rubbish at it but still enjoyed trying to do the puzzles, its a good remaster/port 5star well deserved.

The game isn't terrible. I don't care for the visuals but it was from 25 years ago so I can understand that. The controls can be a little frustrating at times when you try to click on something and it registers as clicking somewhere else. The biggest problem for me is the Google achievements. No matter how many times I unlock an achievement it locks again less than an hour after I get it.
I love the game, but in the options of music it says, none, i click it, i go back to game play, and still that anoying little melody is playing..
I plyed this game 25 years ago and have always wanted my children to experience. I am truly enjoying this game again.

25 years to work on the game and somehow they made a version worse than the original. The original itself wasn't much even for its time. But modern day it serves as a nice time capsule of the 90s FMV craze... However this version is uglier, slower, worse controls, and... well pretty much everything you can think of. Either get it for PC or watch a playthrough on YouTube.
None of the puzzles are logical. It makes no sense
OMG.... We owned this when back in the 90s. We were so excited to be able to play again!! This is so much fun. Some puzzles are hard. That makes it interesting!! Enjoy....

I was at the cake section and despite having changed the audio to subtitles only it still kept repeating verbally with subs. It was so annoying, and the controls on pieces to select kept messing up i got irritated and just uninstalled. Has potential but not worth anything as it is right now.

Still, this is one of the best games I've had a chance to play from the genre. Most of the puzzles are actually challenging. Great story. Happy 25th anniversary, I wish I played before!

Some puzzles are good and keep you going, but some are shockingly logicless which will get you into a habit of walkthru guides. Needs another remaster.

I'm currently playing through this on an Acer Chromebook 15 (C910), and it's handling pretty well with touch controls.  I'd really like it if "Classic" controls would just follow my cursor around, instead of having to click-and-drag for the cursor to move (I get that it's intended for tablets, and that's just the way to do it).  It may be different on tablets, but on my Chromebook, the Bishop puzzle simply DOES NOT WORK with Touch controls (it appears as though the cursor doesn't actually move to the spot I tapped, and instead clicks wherever it's currently hidden), and I have to revert to Classic controls.  With the aforementioned click-and-drag, this puzzle is tedious.  Otherwise, this seems to be a faithful port / update of the original, and it's super fun to play.  I hope 11th Hour is eventually ported, as well.

The graphics did not age well, at all. Whats meant to be scary comes across as extremely narmy. At a certain point, some puzzles become more of a chore than a game, in particular towards the end of the game where either the logic of puzzles aren't apparent (i.e. the floor puzzle) or the puzzles just take too long (i.e. block puzzle). A few puzzles in particular, the microscope "puzzle" (a player vs ai game where ai is at a difficulty youre computer is capable of, so on a mobile its basically impossible) and the piano puzzle (a 12 round simon says that starts you from the beginning if you miss) are especially problematic, as they are essentially rage games in whats otherwise a decent puzzle game. The only saving grace for these is that nearly all puzzles are essentially skippable, but that also somewhat defeats the purpose of having them to begin with.  All in all, I'd say it shows its age, and would probably do better as a full on remake. Otherwise, not really worth the price tag for anything but a bit of nostalgia.
Worth the wait?  Hell yes!!  Love it! Update - This would be great in VR hint hint!

I remember having this game on a Philips CD-i and thoroughly enjoyed it and managed to complete it. This version, but I found the graphics on the puzzle-solving very poor and very difficult to see some of either the lettering or icons. It didnt matter if I chose the original graphic settings or the ultra graphic settings, they all looked poor and difficult to see during the puzzle-solving - which isn't good considering this is the height of enjoyment. Perhaps time would of been better spent by adding a new improved puzzle-solving graphics for android, rather than the use of the original graphics. As for the everything else, I couldn't fault the 3D rendering graphics, the actors and more important the music and sound effects in this. Please look into this. Thank-you for reliving my twentysome years.

content: A horror type puzzle game set in a haunted mansion. Unlock puzzles to gain access to other rooms. Still fun to play...didn't complete it the first time so here I go again! They also did a second game...maybe this is on the cards too. WARNING! The game does take up a lot of memory (0.95 GB and 0.8 GB to save the game)! So an SD card is a necessity unless you don't play other games. Very nostalgic for me and graphics sometimes show their age but still enjoyable. If you like horror and puzzles...play at night!

content: I have the original game on CD Rom in its original jewel case and I love the game

It has aged badly, the puzzles are unimaginative.most puzzles are taken from chess, riddles or Christmas crackers! The game looks terrible now, even after a fine remastering. Shame, I enjoyed it in the past, but looking back now I really don't know why!
Just like the 90's computer version! Hope they also release "The Eleventh Hour"

I was intrigued by this game's history, so I decided to pay up & see what all the fuss was about. It's definitely a product of its time, more like a budget movie interrupted by increasingly frustrating puzzles. Moving through the house becomes tedious; wish the map would allow jumping between rooms. The storyline is nearly impossible to follow because the game triggers video scenes after completing puzzles, rather than in a linear fashion. I had to read the included novella to clarify exactly what was going on. The extras in this anniversary edition are a great feature, especially the novel, original game script, and documentary video. Had to knock off a couple of stars for the buggy save feature. I left the game alone for about a week & returned to find all my save slots defaulting to the beginning of the game. Game error, or further punishment from Henry Stauf? Methinks the latter since I have to do the **** crypt puzzle again! Highly recommended for the nostalgics, or players like myself who enjoy glimpses into old technology. Anyone else: skip this & go play The Room for some genuinely unsettling gameplay.

I remember playing this back on a Philips CD-I; in fact, I believe this game was the reason for spending an exorbitant amount of money for the 4 megabyte MPEG motion video module xD In comparison to the PC of the day this game looked amazing on CD-I! I appreciate all of the extra effort put into the 20th anniversary edition - it makes this game shine as it did back in the 90's! If you've never played 7th Guest - treat yourself! It is one of the greatest of the genre.
Now I look forward to the 11th hour.
Great game :-D
I played this game in my youth and I'm so happy that they brought it to Android I recommend this game for anyone who likes puzzles and that certain air of creepy

I remember this game!   Graphics the same.  So what about 11th hour?  For those that complain about the price.  This game was originally around $50.00.   $5.00 is nothing. Stop being cry babies, no wait, you are apparently are babies.  Know the past and may be you wont grow up as idiots.
I am unable to save. Will add stars once this is fixed.
Loved this game, glad i get to play it again!!
Just brilliant, a great piece of entertainment, I have also installed it on my Laptop with additional software and play it through my big screen TV
I can't get out of the instruction manual.  It won't go back to the puzzle.

For the price, I've played better games for less and even some of the free games were better...as far as game play, graphics & storyline. But it was worth the try, for me it just didn't live up to its hype. I enjoyed The Room and Room 2 much more..maybe it was just too old school for me.

There is either an odd bug, or I'm doing something wrong whenever I've solved a puzzle(s), I then accidentally tap the menu icon instead of the "skip dialogue" icon (which happens to be in the same location). It basically starts me back in the dining room.  The save feature(s) does this too.

Just as fun as I remember plus having the extras is a nice treat. A few small glitches here and there in this port but nothing major.   I would love for you guys to do a port of phantasmagoria or temijin
I would like a refund
It was a spectacular thing when I was a kid and it still is
I love this game!
Just as I Remember on an old pc. Can't believe it is still such a good game on an adrroid phone
Experienced some slowdowns here and there on medium settings. Crashed once. All in all a pretty good port.
I used to watch my Mum and step-dad play this on the PC when I was 8, and it always fascinated me. Well worth the money spent to be able to play it myself finally.
Everything about this game is outstanding. Way ahead of its time!

Workaround for phone rebooting Samsung S5-drop down to original graphics.  Spider puzzle also tried to give me completion badge on failure.  Still, nice reboot and I  will have fun this Halloween season introducing my son to this game.
Brilliant. Runs smoothly. Great conversion
Played this when it first came out. Still fun,still challenging
Wish it ran like this on my old 486 DX4 100

Mojotouch provided great customer service.  The bug is still there.  Just make sure you solve the telescope puzzle even if it shows the room as "solved".   I played the original back in the 90's.  This really isn't much of a remaster.  I have the graphics set to ultra and they're only slightly better than I remember the original being.  Still, it's cool to play again.
replyContent: Dear David, please contact us via email so we can help you with this issue.

content: Brings you back.
Why dont they make games like this anymore? I played this game in the 90s and still love it. No problem with game play, runs good on Samsung tablet. Hopefully there are more old pc games to follow?!
Mojotouch did an amazing job putting this to Android. Hoping for an 11th Hour port as well!
Everything is way too vague even for an adventure game. I played it for about 20 minutes before getting tired of wandering aimlessly. Now I can't even get a refund.
I love this game and am so happy that it has returned, I originally bought it when it came out on the Phillips CD-I unit.

Wow. I remember buying this game when I was 14, it took me nearly the whole day to get my sound blaster driver to work and dos to actually run it. I completed it without any worries. Now I do a quick Google search to help me through the hard parts. We didn't have that luxury back then! LOL
Memories! This is fantastic. I love it.
Can't complain I loved this game 20yrs ago as a kid. Glad I found it again.
Just wish I could remember to do some of the puzzles ha ha
Just like it was...
Love it as much as I did 20 years ago!

Good job on the port, hope 11th Hour is in the works!  For all the people complain about graphics and no "instructions".  Well at the time, the graphics were ahead of their time.  As for instructions, there weren't any with the original either.  Figuring everything out is the whole point!
Can't even play it because the game crashes the second I start a new game.
replyContent: Dear Sean, please contact us so we can assist you with this issue.

content: Great game if you like puzzles! Only a millennial would be dumb enough to say its too hard or no instructions. Watch the cinematics and listen to what's said and that's the clues!
Puzzle game
This was my favorite as a kid and I'm happy to have it back!

I loved the option for classic or touch controls.For those wanting to know the object of a puzzle, if you're facing the stairs, go in the room furthest to the right w/ the telescope puzzle,there's a table as soon as you enter the room with an open book on it,it'll give you a clue for the puzzle you're currently working on, click the book & it takes you back to the puzzle, still can't solve it, go back & get a 2nd clue, the 3rd time you go back and click on the book itll just solve it for you

I loved this game 20 years ago and I love it now.  I had forgotten most of the puzzles and it was fun rediscovering them again.  For those that don't know this, part of the original game was to figure out the rules for each puzzle by the voice hints they give in the game.  That's part of the fun.
Brought back memories
I have paid for this app, as I had the original game but can not get it to download. What does error 499 mean?! I just want to play this game! I have always loved it.
replyContent: Dear Bella, This is some issue with Google Play servers because the game is a big download. Please try to download from different Wi-Fi network.

content: Is nice to replay this old favorite, but it runs awfully badly, even on fairly powerful hardware.
Very good old game
This game is horrible, no directions, hints are useless, and honestly nothing worth the money. Very disappointed!!!
The puzzles are a bit disconnected from the story line.

Graphics are awful and the game gives no direction as far as what to do.  No info provided about the puzzles.  I get that you are supposed to figure them out, but at least knowing the object of the puzzle would be very helpful.
Better off playing in dosbox if you have a original T7G disk laying around

We spent days trying to work out these puzzles back in the day! The music, wow that takes me back. And how it screams at you when you exit the game, "Come Baaaccckkk!!" Well done trilobyte. Great job MojoTouch.
I absolutely love this game ! I played it on the computer when it first came out. It will drive you insane but I still love it.

Decent port of this game. Some issues with the subtitles not accurately showing what is being said. Some puzzles are awkward to play. That is not too surprisng given how diferent the interface is from the original.

I love this game, but some of the UI issues are infuriating. The piano puzzle, for instance, has this problem where notes that are on the far right side of the screen will sometimes make the little hand to take me out of the puzzle pop up, causing me to exit and lose all of my progress, making me want to rip my own face off and eat it every time I have to start ALL OVER after making it to what I have to assume was nearly the end. It would be one thing if I just couldn't remember the notes, but aaaaaggghhhh!
replyContent: Dear Mary Mills, A new version (1.0.0.11) is now live with a fix for the Piano Puzzle and other fixes.

content: How do you move save game files to a new phone? I've already manually moved some over but it ignores them.
replyContent: Thank you Brian! You need to create temp save files (just save anything in the slots you like), before overwrite with your saves from the old device.

content: Yazzz....
Time to revisit an old classic cant wait

Fond memories so keen to revisit the game.  Got to the attic without visiting many of the puzzles and it was game over!  However, after my post here I was contacted by the developers and had great support and problem solved.
replyContent: Dear Antony, Thank you!

content: A nice job reviving a classic for new technology.
Adore it!!!!
Great game. Played it when it first came out and it's still a blast.
And it's not letting me get a refund >:(

Incredible! My friend and I used to get together every weekend, in the mid-90's, to play this puzzle masterpiece. I was very happy to see this remastered and even more so to see it on Android. Thank you MojoTouch!

Still remember pre-ordering the original, waiting for months before I got it. I was so excited and played it endlessly until I finished it. I was so impressed!  So when I noticed the remastered version I immediately decided to buy it. A bit expensive compared to other games, but I wanted to re-experience this game!  And to be honest, it is still kind of a nice game, but it did not age gracefully. The animations look dated, the sound in the "movies" is by no means synchronized with the images, and the interface is really hard to use on my phone. Some of the puzzles were totally impossible; for example the piano puzzle; the first 11 notes go fine, but 12 is so far to the right that the game constantly thinks I want to leave the puzzle. I tried lots of times, and sometimes succeed in getting a bit further but always was kicked out of the game before finishing. Sigh...  In the end I had to skip 2 of the puzzles by using the hint book in the library. I finished the game, but it left me feeling a bit disappointed; this game was better in my memory. I should have left it there.  Now back to Simon the Sorcerer by the same publisher, that game seems to have aged a lot more gracefully...

DownIoaded, however... I'm stuck on the microscope puzzle, which moves the cells incorrectly. If fact, I've struggled with all of the games UI. It's one thing to a puzzle and another to constantly restart because I can't accurately move the cursor.  Sorry guys, I really to love this game.
replyContent: Dear Jax, please contact us via email so we can assist you. Also, the Microscope mini-game is not mandatory in order to play other puzzles and/or complete the game.

content: Loved it then and it's still a great game by today's standards. Now we need the 11th hour remastered.
Will the 11th hour be remastered too? Hope it does!
Has been almost 20 years since I have seen this game. Great game done with a sort of class that does not exist anymore
This is a terrible game.  I want a refund!
The same game I played when it was first released with very little change!
Played it years ago. Awesome remake
Anything after main menu has rainbow pixel corruption all over it.  Not sure how else to describe it.  So distracting it is unplayable.
replyContent:
Dear Joey,

We are investigating this issue (which only happens with Nvidia new SoC). Please switch to 'Medium' Graphics mode in the meantime.

Best,
MojoTouch Support

content: Always loved this game was great to see it on Android.  The 11th hour please

Finished in a couple week of casual playing. I remember the original game being a lot harder, or maybe I actually remember some of the puzzles. The kitchen cabinets was by far the hardest puzzle of them all for me.
Refund please
Great game back then, even better now it's remastered.
The game crashes every time I go to ouja board screen (save/load). Other than that, it brings me back to my high school days. 11th hour would be a good follow up
replyContent: Dear John, please contact us via email so we can assist you with this issue.

content: 4 stars until I get a chance to play!!
Uninstalled after spending way too long on the microscope puzzle. Way too difficult. Fun up til then, but not worth the headache.
replyContent: Dear Joe, The Microscope mini-game is not mandatory in order to play other puzzles and/or complete the game. Please contact us via email if you like a save file to resume playing.

content: Thank you for making this playable again!!
Game can be a little glitchy, but enjoyable.
replyContent: Thanks!

content: I played this game time and time again in my early teens.  It‚Äôs a beautiful transition from PC to touchscreen.  I like how it gives the option of touchscreen or original controls (which in some areas, it‚Äôs a little easier on PC controls).  Ironically, a couple of years ago I ended up emulating both The 7th Guest and The 11th hour on my Droids as older games don‚Äôt take up as much memory and I enjoy revisiting cherished games.  I love how so many companies say that it‚Äôs theft even though it‚Äôs products they don‚Äôt produce or make money on, I still have the physical copies, and you know what, I was still more than happy to buy it officially for my account to support the people that worked so hard on it.  So thank you for bringing the past to life and please bring The 11th Hour out from the shadows!

I loved this game but I think it is harder in this version. Stupid microscope puzzle is impossibly hard. Have to rage quit.  Piano puzzle is maddeningly hard with touch not responding till after animation and repetitive repetitive repetitive repetitive repetitive repetitive repetitive repetitive repetitive dialogue.
Great game, great developer support.
replyContent: Dear Paul, Thank you for the feedback.

content: This brought back so many memories!!! . I had no real issues with the game, however there was one point where the game crashed while working on the microscope puzzle. This was after many,  many attempts at the puzzle. I loaded it right back up and didn't have any more problems after that. I even beat the puzzle without cheating wooo! I highly recommend this game!
Loved the original, still get stumped on a number of puzzles!

I loved this game on PC and finished it. I'm unlikely to have time to play it again on Android, but I've purchased it anyway so that you get the support to hopefully do the same for the 11th Hour as well!

Talk about a blast from the past! Loved this game in the early 90's and love it just as much now. It's still as challenging in fact, I'm  a bit stuck at the moment, but I'll get it  Graphics are great, but during some of the puzzles you can't continue until the narrative is done and that is VERY annoying. And I really wish the map would show where in the house you are, but I love that this was brought back and revived!
replyContent: Thank you. Please send us an email letting us know which narratives can't be skipped with the Skip button.

content: It's ridiculous that it requires 2 gb of free space as it says in the additional text. There's no reason for it to be so big. I can't download it unless I wipe my phone clean.  It's a shame because I really wanted to play it..... where can I get a refund?
replyContent: Dear Erica, please contact us via email.

content: Excellent

Loved the original game and now I love being able to play it on my phone.  The remastered score is AMAZING. Finished the game and now I'm enjoying the extras (reading the "book" now). I did hit a bug that was a rare bug from the original game, but they were very helpful in getting me past it. Well worth the price. RECOMMEND! I had this game for pc when I was a kid, never got far cause it had a glitch finally a retry!!!!! THANK YOU! But I'm having a issue I've deleted  most of my apps., And i used a micro SD and it's still saying I don't have enough space what the heck!!! HELP!!
replyContent: Dear Nikki, Thank you for your feedback. Please contact us via email so we can help you fix any issues you have.

content: I usually use scumvm to play this on my phone but now i dont need to thanks guys
Great comeback!
Why does the subtitle say " I won't have to start again" when I select the restart puzzle button? I'm pretty sure this is a typo

An outstanding enhanced blast from the past! Plus, almost instant developer response when I had a concern (which was fixed in the latest update). Smooth and fast animations on Galaxy Tab 4 8". First played this... oh gosh, more years ago than I care to remember... so I'm looking forward to exploring the mansion again. Thank you.
Some are more equal than others.
Truly a classic that came home
The 7th guest paid for it and can't get. Installed
replyContent: Dear Teresa, there is/was some issue with Google Play servers. Please try the new version 1.0.0.7 .

content: I remember this game well. Such good conversion to phone and tablet. I can't wait for its sequel, The Twelfth Hour if that gets converted as well.
I loved this game as a kid and found it to be challenging once again as an adult!

I'm stuck in the attic and can't get out. I'm a little disappointed that this game cost $6 and the is nothing remastered about it. The graphics are exactly the same, the audio is totally off with the videos, and had glitches. I liked this game when I was younger, but I was hoping for a lot more for paying $6 and the game still had issues.
replyContent:
Dear Tiffanie, Sorry. A fix for the attic is NOW live ( version 1.0.0.7) .
Since we increased the audio quality from the original, maybe there are places that the syncing is not perfect - we would gladly appreciate if you can send us an email pointing us to such places

content: Great stuff but audio sync gets lost and I'm stuck in the attic after solving the skyscraper problem DESPITE the last release supposedly fixing this. Four stars otherwise.
replyContent: Dear Iain, Sorry. A fix for the attic is NOW live ( version 1.0.0.7 ). Since we increased the audio quality from the original, maybe there are places that the syncing is not perfect - we would gladly appreciate if you can send us an email pointing us to such places

content: I first discovered this game when i was 8 years old, even though it scared the s*** out of me, I loved it. For one of the very first CD-ROM games it was fantastic! This is an excellent re-mastered edition, that really brings this game to the 21st century! Oh.. and it is so pretty in HD! Thanks again for letting me re-live my childhood.
You should pot The 11th Hour on here too. I loved the sequel just a Mitch as the first.
The game is great and just as much fun as the original, but every update seems to change something for the worse. Latest update changed the subtitle font color and made it unreadable on my S5.
replyContent: Dear Trey, Thank you for the feedbacks.  A fix for the subtitles is NOW live ( version 1.0.0.7 ) .

content: Great game but it is glitchy. After the update, the text for the subtitles is all transparent. The bishop puzzle is buggy when trying to move.
replyContent: Dear Jennifer, A fix for the subtitles is NOW live ( version 1.0.0.7 ) .

content: This was one of my absolute favorite games when I was a kid. The developers have done a fantastic job putting together a complete, and improved, version of the game. It even includes special features I had never seen before! I encountered a glitch as I neared the very end of the game. I sent an email to the developer and received near immediate response. It took a couple back and forth emails to troubleshoot the problem, but they resolved it amazingly well. I couldn't have asked for better support.

It's all about memories in this game. If you were a child of the 90's, then you have to get this PC classic that showed the power of the PC in that day. Like with most things from a specific system, they don't age well, but your mainly getting it for that retro nostalgia feeling. On the bright side some of the puzzles that were taxing on the PC run super fast so they aren't as bad as they were then.
I loved this game when I was younger and CD Roms were a thing.  Overall a good port and nice extras.
Great classic! Extras are fantastic! Highly recommended.
I love this game
I'm so happy this has finally come to Android!  I've been playing this since the 90s and it never gets old.  Runs great so far on my Tab Pro 8.4!  Looking forward to 11th Hour  and Clandestiny.
Thank you!  This was a great play on the pc and a perfect conversion to Android.  I wanted to express my appreciation for the great job!
Loving it - this is what games should be like!

Could never completely get through the game without help. But loved playing it back in the day. This was the one game I had been looking for for my tablet. Then finally found it yesterday. Thanks guys. It works on my Android Kit-Kat 4.4.
I feel like a kid again.  Thanks
I remember bringing this thing home to my new state of the art 486DX 33 in 1993!
I loved this game in the early 90s it was groundbreaking. The remastered version is just as amazing. I don't play games on tablets but I'm making an exception for this.

I played this for hours and hours back in the 90's, so glad to get the chance to play it again after all this time! Today's update does look to have fixed the artifact issues on the bottom of the screen, but only after starting a new game. When my old save loaded up there was still a small line of fixed pixels spanning the bottom of the screen. Looks good now though after starting a new game. Will report any further issues that might pop up after I spend more time exploring the game. I'm using a Nexus 7 2012 running latest Lollipop build.
replyContent: Dear Chris, Thank you for your feedback.

content: Its hard to believe I was 13 when this came out originally. It still holds up remarkably well, especially with the enhanced visuals and the easier to click a specific spot controls. I would have been satisfied with that but they went above and beyond with all the extras thrown in as a great fan service. My hats off to Mojo Touch and to Trilobyte for making such a time tested game 22 years ago.
Revising review after time with customer support. Issues resolved.
replyContent: Dear Eileen, Thank you for your feedback.

content: It's 1993 on my cell phone. I missed this game. I miss DOS on my PC. Just listening to the opening makes me young again.Will always enjoy this  game!
The guys have done a great job bringing this game to android, sound, graphics first class and moving around the mansion is really smooth. Great job, now bring on 11th hour!
This was my game back in the day.  Sooo oo excited! Thanks guys, can't wait to see the 13th doll
Many thanks MojoTouch and Trilobyte for porting this game over to Android. Brings back a lot of memories playing it on a Phillips CD-i when it first came out!
So awesome to see this available now. One of my first CDROM games for PC.  So cool that I can play it on my phone now. Thank you trilobyte games!!!!
Awesome classic
Game runs like a charm so far.
I love this game.  However,  it took up so much space I had to delete everything from my phone just for it to download.  Then there wasn't enough memory for it to play :(
Great new edition, thank you!
